intro: Aeschynomene stipitata, commonly known as whitestem aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small white or pale purple flowers are clustered in racemes, and it is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Aeschynomene stipitata is also valued for its potential in forage and soil stabilization due to its rapid growth and nitrogen-fixing abilities.
